radiographic_examinations.findings: Linear density in the peripheral right upper lobe thought to be atelectasis.

Slightly decreased liver echotexture suggestive of edema, no intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation, normal gallbladder, common bile duct 5 mm in diameter, diffusely hypoechoic pancreas, normal spleen, left renal cyst 1.4 cm in diameter, no hydronephrosis or stones.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up ultrasound revealed new dilatation of the main pancreatic duct.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal pancreas, minimal dilatation of proximal intrahepatic biliary tree, right adrenal adenoma 1.2 cm in diameter, and scattered benign hepatic cysts.

radiographic_examinations.date: On second and third hospital days
radiographic_examinations.findings: New dilatation of the main pancreatic duct and kidneys of normal size, no evidence of renal-artery stenosis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Prior ultrasonography showed normal kidneys and pancreas obscured by bowel gas.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal kidneys, pancreas obscured by bowel gas.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent ultrasound during admission showed diffusely increased echogenicity of kidneys, with new, diffusely increased echogenicity.
